intro: Solms-laubachia pulcherrima f. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed flame tree, is a striking ornamental plant native to South America. It is a member of the Bignoniaceae family, characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in vibrant shades of orange and red. The plant features compound leaves with narrow, elongated leaflets, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it suitable for tropical and subtropical climates. Its ornamental value is further enhanced by its long-lasting blooms and ability to grow as a small tree or shrub.
